titleStmt.title: Letter from John G. Willis to William L. Marcy, November 16, 1854

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from John G. Willis to William L. Marcy
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

opener.salute:
Hon. Wm. L Marcy
Secretary of State U.S.A.

div1.p: Sir Your circular of Octo 8th, '53 March 15th - & September 1854 more received since my return from St. Paul de Loanda at which Port I have the honor of acting as U. S. Commercial Agent.
On my arrival I addressed the department to that effect & now advise you of my intended return to that port which will probably take place about the 28th or 30 inst.

As many of the Queries in the Circular of Oct. 8 53, & Interrogatories of March 15th 54 cannot be answered by me at the present time, I am compelled to postpone my answer until my return to Loanda. I much regret that I am unable to give the desired information previous to the close of the year 1854 but on my arrival at Loanda I will give it my earliest attention & forward by first opportunity.
Accompaning this I forward to your Department the Returns of the Coml Agency at the Port of St. Paul de Loanda ending June 30 '54.

closer.salute:
I am Sir, very Respectfully
Your obedient Servant
